value.0: I welcome you into the ShadowGuard, my <brother/sister>...
Would you like some help in your mission?
As you wish.
Very good, <mister/missus> <LastName>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 9. USING THIS FOR TESTING AT THE MOMENT! >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_2_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 2. >>
You should speak with Overlord Vhorkas.
There will be time for conversation when we are away from Ghaarak, <FirstName>...
You should speak with Markius, <FirstName>. He'll know what to do...
Death to these unnatural beings!
The Crimson Prophet must be stopped!
Shall we be on our way to the Docks once more, <FirstName>?
As you wish, <FirstName>. Be wary of danger, and know I shall await your return here, should you need my assistance further.
Markius wishes to speak you, <lad/lass>. It seems Ghaarak is no longer safe for you...
<StartAction>[The tall, grim man standing before you appears expressionless as you approach.]</Start>
Markius Albright, at your service. Would you care to have me accompany you to the docks? My talents lie in subterfuge and deceit, but I do not shirk from combat either...
Very well then. I shall remain here should you change your mind.
I shall do all I can to ensure your safety, <FirstName>. Come, let us be on our path...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_1_MAIN" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_LYEN" >>
Markius wishes to speak you, <lad/lass>. It seems Ghaarak is no longer safe for you...
<StartAction>[The tall man standing before you bows at your approach.]</Start>
I extend my greetings to you, <FirstName>, <CUSTOM6001> of Okaris <LastName>. I am Markius Albright, and I stand at your service.
So, it seems we meet again, <FirstName>. Markius Albright, at your service.
I was with a companion of mine, a sorcerer named Harkon, on business here in the Imperial District. We were trapped within this district when the Grand Hall was overtaken...
<StartAction>[Markius' eyes darken.]</Start> Harkon has gone to the Grand Hall, in an attempt to free the Market District gates from the sorceries surrounding them.
I must say I am worried for his safety, though, for he has now been gone quite some time.
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_LYEN" >>
Would you care for me to join you?
Good. Let us be on our way.
You seem a bit preoccupied with your current companion, <FirstName>. It appears to me as though you have all the assistance you need for now. Should that change, though, do seek me out again.
Farewell to you, <FirstName>. I wish you luck.

<StartAction>[Markius Albright stands quietly, lost in thought, before a painting of a family. At the sound of your approaching footsteps, however, he turns quickly towards you.]</Start> Greetings, <FirstName>.
May I ask what business it is you wish to discuss with me?
<StartAction>[Markius nods.]</Start> As you wish, <FirstName>. Feel free to return to me any time you wish to talk further.
<StartAction>[Markius nods somberly, his eyes seeming to drift back to some old memory.]</Start> The Final Initiation... There is little I can say regarding it, for it changes for each of us...

Know that Rakha will want to test your loyalty to Him, and you should expect to be faced with demons from your past. The Great Savior will want to know that He can place His unwavering trust in you...

Beyond that, merely keep your wits about you, and trust to instinct. You will have to be your own guide through the trial, but so long as you stay true to yourself, you should have little trouble completing Rakha's tasks...
I must warn you that I do not pry often into the lives of my companions, but you may ask as you will. I shall try to answer your questions as best I can...
The Overlord has proved his worth to us time and again, and he keeps our operations running smoothly. The ShadowGuard owes its existence to Overlord Vhorkas, and for that, we must give him respect.

I have noticed, however, that Vhorkas ensures he knows a great deal regarding each of our pasts. He is a cunning man, and I often feel as though he uses his knowledge to manipulate us to his own ends...
I respect the Halfling's cunning ways, and he uses his wits well. He and I have taught one another a great many tricks in subterfuge, and for that, I am grateful to have him at my side.
However, I must say I do not care for Tarin's constant foolishness. His love of the card tables has often brought us into danger, and I would see him use more discretion in his activities...
Kara and I both prefer our own company to that of others, but beyond that, we have little in common. She comes from a life of nobility and wealth, whereas I know only the ways of the wild...
Kara's charms cannot be underestimated, and do not let her fool you. She fully understands the power her beauty grants over men, and uses it to her advantage, when the need arises...

Markius is a fine leader to us, capable in both his role as our captain and among the front ranks of battle. He may be stern, taking his duties quite seriously, but I must confess I respect that in a leader...
He and I do not often perform our tasks in a similar fashion, but I would gladly stand by Markius in any battle. You can always count on Markius to stand loyally at your side...
<StartAction>[At first, it seems Markius has not heard your words, his gaze drawn back to the picture before him. Finally, however, he begins to speak...]</Start>
My past... my past is a difficult story for me to tell, <FirstName>. It... it has left many scars, many which have never healed completely...

<StartAction>[A sad expression comes over Markius' face.]</Start> I know you do not mean your words, <FirstName>, but they cut deeply none the same. Still, you have lost your father... not so long ago, and I suppose it should be expected...
It... it is alright, <FirstName>. Perhaps... perhaps I have kept this to myself for far too long... it is good... good to speak of it for a change...
<StartAction>[Markius' eyes moisten slightly as he runs his hand along the happy faces upon the portrait's surface.]</Start> This was once my family, <FirstName>... and a happy family it was...

<StartAction>[You look upon the picture to see broad smiles upon the faces of a simple man and woman. Below them sit two children, a young girl and a adolescent, lanky boy who could only be Markius himself...]</Start>

We were a simple people, <FirstName>, ranchers of the Northern Reaches. Wealth meant little to us, for we had happiness in each other's company, living far away from the deceptions and debauchery of the civilized world...

That all changed twelve years ago... on my sister's seventh birthday. A group of men claiming to be travelling merchants came to our door, seeking shelter. My father, a gracious man, allowed them room and board.
It was only that night that we came to learn of the men's treachery. They were Bloodhawks, savage slavers sailing the coasts in search of defenseless people to abduct...
My mother and father were deemed too old to be of use, and the slavers savagely butchered them... right in front of the eyes of my sister and me...
My sister was taken to the Bloodhawks' ship, for they deemed her to be a good sale as a future house maiden for some noble lord. That was the last time I ever saw her...
I was turned over into the custody of the man who ordered the attack on my family... a Bloodhawk by the name of Jhordak...

For many years, he forced me to serve as a slave upon his ships, sailing from town to town to collect more innocents for their vile trade. He was a cruel overseer, and every night I dreamed of making him pay for his deeds.

After spending several years under the Bloodhawks' eye, I saw a chance to escape. We were docked far to the north of here, and in the still of the night, I sneaked upon the ship guard, slicing his throat and fleeing into town.
The Bloodhawks never searched for me, for I was only a boy, and not of much consequence to them. I, however, made a vow to have my revenge against those who had destroyed my past...
For the last six years, I have hunted the Bloodhawks ruthlessly, slaying all I find. In fact, that is how I came to meet Overlord Vhorkas and the ShadowGuard...
The ShadowGuard were seeking to route the Bloodhawks' bases from the Sharakhan Empire, and during the course of one of their operations, I aided them in finding their prey.
I suppose the Overlord was pleased with my performance, for afterwards he offered to bring me here. I promised to aid his tasks, so long as he aided me in ending the vile trade of slavery forever.

I have since sought out the Bloodhawks wherever our destiny takes us, and I finally had my revenge against Jhordak in Ghaarak. I had thought his death would bring me a bit of peace... but I must confess it has not...
I still wonder what became of my sister... perhaps she still remains a slave to the Bloodhawks' will, an unwilling prisoner in some noble's house...
<StartAction>[Makrius' eyes flinch slightly.]</Start> Per... perhaps you're right, <FirstName>. I... I should not let me hopes get so high...
<StartAction>[Markius' nods his head.]</Start> I must keep trying... it... it is all I have left...
<StartAction>[Makius gives you a soft smile.]</Start> Thank you, <FirstName>. Your words mean a great deal to me. And... and it was good to talk of these matters...
I thank you for taking the time to hear my story, <FirstName>, but I must ask you to leave my chambers now. I... I need some time alone...
<StartAction>[Markius bows his head low before the portrait of his family, oblivious to your presence. You decide it would probably be a good time to leave him in peace...]</Start>
<StartAction>[Markius' mouth draws tight, and several tears fall silently upon the smooth surface of his family painting.]</Start>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_1_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 1. >>
<StartAction>[Markius looks upon you, his expression drawn in troubled thought.]</Start> Finally, it is over... Jhordak has met his doom...

<StartAction>[Markius gives you a disapproving glare.]</Start> Since you aided me in defeating Jhordak, I shall forgive your greed... this time. I hope in time you shall learn to think of someone other than yourself, however...
As am I, <FirstName>, as am I. No one should be subjected to the horrors of the Bloodhawks' crimes...
<StartAction>[Markius gives you a solemn nod.]</Start> And I thank you for it, <lad/lass>. Know that you have my eternal gratitude for your aid in this matter.

Some fellow travelers have made the journey north with me and are boarding at the Tavern: Kara Dy'nesh and Tarin Lightfingers. Perhaps you have met them already. If not, I recommend you seek them out and make their acquaintance.
Rakha's blessing upon you, <FirstName>... I wish we could speak further but I need to be alone with my thoughts for now... We will meet again, you have my word.
<StartAction>[With that, Markius Albright turns and leaves, his form disappearing in the dark reaches underneath the city of Ghaarak...]</Start>
We should set off as quickly as we can to confront the Bloodhawks at the Ravenclaw Tavern, and see if we may discern the location of their slaver base...
Come, <FirstName>. Together, you and I shall go to the Ravenclaw Tavern, and face these criminals side by side...
Lead the way, <FirstName>... for you are more knowledgeable of this city than I. Rest assured that I will stand ready to aid you as needed...
You seem to be occupied with another companion at the moment, <FirstName>. Why don't you finish your business with them, and return to me when you find yourself a bit more available?
You have done much for me already, <FirstName>. However, I have learned that Bloodhawks have thrived here and have a much larger force then I anticipated...
I fear that I alone would have little success striking against these slavers, for they are likely well armed and dangerous. I will still attempt to drive them out but I need help.
Would you be willing to lend me some assistance and help track down these slavers? Together, we could put an end to their trade once and for all.
<StartAction>[Markius seems disappointed by your answer, but nods his head.]</Start> As you wish, <lad/lass>. If you decide differently later, speak with me again.

Is that all you care about, <FirstName>? I have nothing left to offer as a reward, but if all you desire is wealth, I'm sure there will be a fair share in the Bloodhawks' den. Would that be enough to sate your thirst for gold?
I would, but I fear I alone would be of little use against the Bloodhawks. I need your aid to bring justice to these slavers.
I'm glad to hear it, <FirstName>. You are a good <man/woman>, and I won't forget what you have done for me.
Have you brought any news regarding the Bloodhawk's base?
I suggest you seek out Shrak, and see what you may learn from him. If he truly has been assisting the Bloodhawks, I believe he will have the information I seek.

<StartAction>[Markius seems a bit surprised by your question.]</Start> Well, apart from a general distaste for the practice of slavery, I have... personal reasons... for seeing the Bloodhawks meet a fitting fate.

<StartAction>[Markius' jaw clenches, as he recalls an unwelcome memory.]</Start> No, not now. Perhaps if I get the chance to know you better, but that is a tale I do not wish to relate it at the moment.
I do not yet consider you a, <FirstName>, so I will wait for another to aid me. If you change your mind and let this matter drop, return to me when you have the information I seek.
It is simply a story I tell only those closest to me, so please forgive me if I seem a bit rude. Perhaps, in time, I will speak more of this to you, should the time come that I call you my friend.
I did initially, but Shrak discovered my true intentions. I imagine he will go to great lengths to hide any evidence of his guilt from me, thus my need for your aid in this matter.
You may be able to convince Shrak to tell you, if his trust can be gained. Shrak is also a bit of a coward, from what I hear, and might be intimidated into giving you the information.
If you cannot get the information from Shrak personally, you may be able to find some sort of evidence either on his person, or near his merchant stand.
Very well. I shall await your return here.

<StartAction>[Markius takes the letter from you and reads over it quickly.]</Start> So... It seems Shrak uses two Bloodhawk contacts at the Ravenclaw Tavern to communicate with the rest of their organization.
You have served your purpose well, <FirstName>. I shall have a chance to finally track down the foul Bloodhawk base within this city...
Have you decided to listen to my offer after all?
<StartAction>[The man standing before you appears solem and grim, but the glint in his eyes seems to carry an unusual wisdom and strength.]</Start>
Good <quarterday> to you, young <sir/madam>. I am Markius Albright, a traveller of the Northern Reaches, and I extend my greetings to you.
Well, I suppose you are not one for formalities, a trait I can relate to. I believe I have a proposal that will interest you, if you will give me a moment of your time.
<StartAction>[Markius' expression does not visibly change at your insult, but you sense that he is rather unimpressed with your behavior.]</Start>
Perhaps I am not so noble as you, <sir/madam>, but I would ask that we speak regarding a matter that may interest you. Will you not take a moment to at least hear my plea?
Now that the formalities are out of the way, I would speak with you, if you have a moment, regarding a proposal that may benefit both of us.
Shall you not at least hear me out before refusing my proposal? It can do little harm to listen to my words, and you may always turn it down, if you so desire.
<StartAction>[Markius gives you a disapproving look, but seems to relent in his persistence.]</Start> So be it, then. If you change your mind later, please do come by and speak with me.
It has come to my attention that a group of slavers, part of a broader organization known as the Bloodhawks, has set up a base somewhere here in Ghaarak.

These foul criminals have been collecting their victims from the people of the Market District, to later be sent north and sold into a life of cruel servitude. I would like for you to aid me in bringing an end to their activity in this city.
<StartAction>[Markius' face stiffens with grim resolve.]</Start> It is just this sort of attitude that has allowed the Bloodhawks to operate for as long as they have!
Still, I am in need of assistance, and I am willing to pay for your aid in this matter. Perhaps gold will prove enough to warm your heart to the plight of Ghaarak's people?

<StartAction>[Markius frowns at your words.]</Start> I would hope that your duty as an Imperial citizen would prove strong enough to desire an end to such activity in Ghaarak. But if you need further motivation, I am willing to reward your efforts.
It is reassuring to know that you will stand against such a disgusting practice. Do not worry, the task I wish you to perform is a minor one and I shall reward you for your service.
I am willing to pay you 100 gold pieces if you help me discover the location of the Bloodhawk's base here in Ghaarak. Once I have this information, I will take care of the Bloodhawks personally.
That is your choice to make, but should you change your mind later I will be here waiting.
<StartAction>[Markius' eyes can barely contain his distaste for your actions.]</Start> A mercenary, then? So be it. If that is the price you place upon freedom, I shall reward you with such.
That is quite noble of you, <sir/madam>. I am pleased to see that you are as concerned as I am by this unlawful practice.
One of this district's merchants, a dark fellow named Shrak, is rumored to have dealings with the Bloodhawks. I believe he may know the location of the slaver base here in the city.
Oh... did he, now... I was hoping he wouldn't be so forward. Nevertheless, it is a pleasure to make your acquaintance.
<FirstName>, we must hurry from this place. I must aid Harkon in his attempt to stop the Crimson Prophet's escape...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_LYEN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>

Comment.value: Default dialogue when the henchman is a member of the player's party.

value.0: What do you wish of me, <FirstName>?
As you wish, <FirstName>.
As you wish, <FirstName>. I hope that we may continue to work with one another at a later time, and I bid you a fond farewell.
Should you decide that you do indeed need my aid, you may find me within the Imperial Academy. Farewell, and good luck.
I ask that you remain at my side for the moment, <FirstName>... at least until we have solved the matter of the Bloodhawks. Come. Let us finish this foul business quickly...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_LYEN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
My services are at your command, <FirstName>.
Very well, <FirstName>.
Very well, <FirstName>.
Fine, as shall leave such things to you.
I will try to heal you even if I am being attacked at close range.
Very well, I will heal you only if I am not in hand-to-hand combat.
As you wish.
I do hope you are not trying tell me something, but I shall do as you wish.
I can do that. When the combat begins I'll rush in and use melee weapons.
Of course. When the combat begins I'll stay back and attack with my ranged weapons from a distance. I'll switch weapons if the enemies get too close.
What would you like me to do?
Very well. I will avoid melee combat unless I am cornered.
As you wish, <FirstName>.
That may be hard to judge, but I shall do my best.
Very well, I'll wait until the last possible moment.
Very well. I will do what I feel is best.
No, I work better alone.
Yes, I would.
Not right now. You stay here.
Let's go, Markius.
Actually, I'm thinking of choosing someone else...
Sounds just like what I need. Let's go.
A pleasure to meet you, Markius... but I must ask how you know my name...
Markius... what are you doing here?
And where is this Harkon now?
Not right now.
Yes, I would like that.
I don't have much to talk about at the moment. Perhaps we can speak later.
Do you have any advice for me regarding the Final Initiation?
I see. Let me ask you about something else...
I would like to speak with you regarding the other members of the ShadowGuard...
Actually, I'd like to discuss something else...
What do you make of Overlord Vhorkas?
How do you feel about Tarin Lightfingers?
What are your thoughts on Kara Dy'nesh?
I would like to know more about Markius Albright...
I see... Let me ask you about another of the ShadowGuard members...
I was hoping I might be able to speak to you regarding your past... I know so little of about you...
Must I listen to this self-pity for much longer?! Out with your story already!
I... I did not mean to intrude into affairs which trouble you, Markius...
I take it this has something to do with the family in that portrait?
What happened to you and your sister?
Or perhaps she's dead... There's no sense worrying over such nonsense!
If she's still alive, I'm sure you'll find her, Markius...
I will help you find her, Markius. Know that you shall always have my aid...
That's horrible, Markius! I... I'm so sorry...
Yes and it's time you reward me for my help.
I'm just glad to see Ghaarak free of slavers.
I was glad to be of help, Markius...
I've done what I can, Markius. You're on your own.
I might be willing to help if the price was right.
Why don't you go yourself?
Yes, I will aid you.
I would be glad to help put an end to these Bloodhawks.
No, not yet.
Why are you so adamant about stopping these slavers?
Perhaps you should tell me these reasons.
Either you tell me, or I shall not aid you.
Fair enough. I did not mean to intrude.
Why haven't you confronted Shrak yourself?
How do you suggest I get this information from Shrak?
I'll see what I can find regarding the Bloodhawks.
I found this letter in Shrak's possession.
Two of their operatives are staying at the Ravenclaw Tavern...
Two of their operatives are staying at the Ravenclaw Tavern...
<StartAction>[Remain silent.]</Start>
How may I help you?
Why should I concern myself with you? You seem little more than a petty thug...
Pleased to meet you. I'm <FullName>.
I'm a busy <man/woman> and I have no time for frivolous matters!
Enough of your ramblings! I have no desire to deal with you!
Very well, what do you need?
What do you wish to discuss, Markius?
So long as they do not disturb me, I could care less what they do.
Why should I be concerned with these people?
I may be willing to help you... if the price is right.
I would gladly help you. What would you have me do?
Forget it. If it's Bloodhawk business then it isn't mine.
Make it 200 gold, and you have yourself a deal.
I will aid you, but no reward is needed.
Fair enough, I will assist you.
Markius? You must be the one Instructor Jarvis sent me to meet.
I would like to manage your inventory.
I feel that we should part paths for the moment.
Could you please not disable traps?
Could you please disable traps?
Heal me even if there are enemies near you.
Do not heal me if there are enemies near you.

Default dialogue when the henchman is a member of the player's party.
Default dialogue when the henchman is a member of the player's party.

value.0: Let's talk about your weapon-switching tactics.

LinkComment.value: Default dialogue when the henchman is a member of the player's party.

value.0: I have no further need to change your tactics at this moment.
I don't want you to engage in close-range combat at all. Move away from the enemy if they are too close!
Be aggressive. If you see enemies getting any closer than 6 meters or so, charge with melee!
I think you should switch to melee if the enemy is at a medium distance, between 4 and 5 meters away.
Since you're so good with your missile weapon, wait until the enemy gets relatively close, say less than 3 meters, before you switch to a melee weapon.
I want you to trust your instinct as to when to switch betwen melee and missile weapons.
